The second circle should also have its center at [0.375, 0.375] but a smaller radius of 0.1875. Now, set up a scaling transformation for the sketch by setting sketch_scale to 0.75. After that, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Lastly, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.125 towards the normal and with no extrusion in the opposite direction. Set the operation for this extrusion as "NewBodyFeatureOperation". Part 2: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. This part will have a length of 0.7456, a width of 0.25, and a height of 0.7456. Create a new coordinate system with the same euler angles as part 1 but with a different translation vector: [0.0022, 0.25, 0.0318]. In this new coordinate system, create a sketch on the XY plane. Within the sketch, create a series of line segments and a circle to form the rectangular prism and the centered cylindrical hole in it: 1. Line from [0.0, 0.3839] to [0.1511, 0.0407] 2. Line from [0.1511, 0.0407] to [0.5239, 0.0] 3. Line from [0.5239, 0.0] to [0.7456, 0.3025] 4. Line from [0.7456, 0.3025] to [0.5944, 0.6457] 5. Line from [0.5944, 0.6457] to [0.2216, 0.6864] 6. Line from [0.2216, 0.6864] to [0.0, 0.3839] 7. Circle with center at [0.3728, 0.3432] and radius of 0.1875 After creating the curves and loops, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7456. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system defined earlier and then extrude it along the Z-axis with the following parameters: extrude_depth_towards_normal = 0.25, extrude_depth_opposite_normal = 0.0, and sketch_scale = 0.7456. Set the operation as a "JoinFeatureOperation".</description>
